title: Strengthening Social Studies Competencies Through STEAM Project-Based Learning Assessment

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Self-directed learning in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, solving community issues through social studies integration during project implementation

learning_goals: Students can analyze real-world community problems and design solutions using a STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Mathematics) approach

Learners can complete a STEAM project (e.g., solar-powered car design) over 1–6 months, undergo three or more peer/teacher feedback sessions, and achieve an average score of 4/5 or higher on a rubric evaluating integrative thinking competencies (creativity, practicality, integration).
Learners can operationalize the problem-definition–solution–evaluation stages through four weeks of self-directed project implementation

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
